data.title: Sweden’s most popular audiobooks on BookBeat, Nextory and Storytel
data.meta_description: What’s most interesting here for those of us outside Sweden is to compare the lists of the three platforms and see how platform exclusivity impacts consumers, and also which authors and titles from outside Sweden are resonating with the Swedish consumer. The three main digital subscription channels in Sweden, BookBeat, Nextory and Storytel, have produced […]
data.text:
What’s most interesting here for those of us outside Sweden is to compare the lists of the three platforms and see how platform exclusivity impacts consumers, and also which authors and titles from outside Sweden are resonating with the Swedish consumer.

The three main digital subscription channels in Sweden, BookBeat, Nextory and Storytel, have produced their lists of the most popular titles, authors and narrators on their respective platforms. N.B. the list is specifically for Sweden and of course is not quite the full year.

What’s most interesting here for those of us outside Sweden is to compare the lists of the three platforms and see how platform exclusivity impacts consumers, and also which authors and titles from outside Sweden are resonating with the Swedish consumer.

This year’s most listened audiobooks on BookBeat 2020

Spegelmannen – Lars Kepler

Where the crayfish sing – Delia Owens

Mythomaniac – Sofie Sarenbrant

Wings of silver – Camilla Läckberg

The Seven Sisters – Lucinda Riley

Moon Sister – Lucinda Riley

Stormsister – Lucinda Riley

Before the clouds come – Mari Jungstedt

The Pearl Sister – Lucinda Riley

The Shadow Sister – Lucinda Riley

This year’s most listened author on BookBeat 2020

Lucinda Riley

Sofie Sarenbrant

Lars Kepler

Margit Sandemo

JK Rowling

Camilla Läckberg

Nora Roberts

Anna Jansson

Jussi Adler-Olsen

Jan Guillou

Gunilla Leining

Katarina Ewerlöf

Stefan Sauk

Anna Maria Käll

Jonas Malmsjö

Marie Richardson

Mirja Turestedt

Julia Dufvenius

Magnus Roosmann

Tomas Bolme

Most listened audiobooks on Nextory 2020 – adults

Wings of silver – Camilla Läckberg

Double life: A true story – Iris Mårtenson

A cage of gold – Camilla Läckberg

The mythomaniac – Sofie Sarenbrant

Where the crayfish sing – Delia Owens

Fall asleep fast – Camilla Gyllensvan

Shame corner – Sofie Sarenbrant

Spegelmannen – Lars Kepler

Rest in peace – Sofie Sarenbrant

Before the clouds come – Mari Jungstedt

LasseMaja’s summer holiday book: A day at the beach – Martin Widmark

Bockarna Bruse – Josefin Götestam & Staffan Götestam

Who saves Alfons Åberg? – Gunilla Bergström

The rabbit who did not want to sleep – Lilian Edvall

Vattenlandet – Petrus Dahlin

A Minecraft zombies diary 1: My life as a zombie – Zack Zombie

Bamse and Dunderklockan – Fabian Nordlander, Joakim Gunnarsson & Tomas Tivemark

Mickey Mouse & Helium: Time to Sleep – Camilla Brinck

Good night Alfons Åberg – Gunilla Bergström

This year’s most listened books on Storytel 2020

Mythomaniac – Sofie Sarenbrant, read by Katarina Ewerlöf, Bookmark Publisher

Wings of silver – Camilla Läckberg, read by Mirja Turestedt, Bokförlaget Forum

Where the crayfish sing – Delia Owens, read by Anna Maria Käll, Bonnier Audio

Before the clouds come – Mari Jungstedt, read by Katarina Ewerlöf, Albert Bonniers Förlag

Spegelmannen – Lars Kepler, read by Jonas Malmsjö, Albert Bonniers Förlag

The death list – Anna Jansson, read by Marie Richardsson, Norstedts

A cage of gold – Camilla Läckberg, read by Mirja Turestedt, Bonner Audio

Frozen gold – Rolf Börjling & Cilla Börjlind, uploaded by Nina Zanjani, Norstedts

Where’s Olle? – Part 1. The Disappearance – Martin Ezpeleta, uploaded by Martin Ezpeleta, Storytel Original

Knutbyflickan – Life in the sect’s innermost circle – Linnéa Kuling, read by Linnéa Kuling, Storytel Original

All lists courtesy of Boktugg. See links above for more on each list.
